result.execSummary:
The defendant Marvell Clayton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation on case 21CM3140. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Court set restitution at zero.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marvell Clayton

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Marvell Clayton in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Marvell Clayton in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNTS 1, 2 and 3 of amended information.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction, with credit for 117 days served.
AS TO COUNT 2: Court setenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to count 1.
AS TO COUNT 3: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to count 1.

- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation on case 21CM3140. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

- Court set restitution at zero.
*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 

Filed: 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Jury Instructions

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Marvell Clayton not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense reports that there might be a global offer with case 2021CM3140. Defense requested a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 28.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Marvell Clayton in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris; both appear by video.  Defendant Marvell Clayton in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Marvell Clayton not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with John D.O.; Pick 'n Save; Akaya D.B.; Tiffany C.M.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marvell Clayton in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Marvell Clayton in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marvell Clayton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  AS TO COUNT 1:  Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
